title: Federalism compared to British colonial government

content.question: The principle of federalism embodied in the United States Constitution had most in common with which of the following earlier aspects of British colonial government?

choices.label: The autonomy of colonial legislatures from Great Britain
The absence of colonial representation in Parliament
The enforcement of commercial regulations by British officials
The authority of the king over his colonial governors

content.answer: The autonomy of colonial legislatures from Great Britain

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
